SPScript Docs
Class: List

List

new List(dao)

Represents a SharePoint list. You shouldn't ever be new'ing this class up up yourself, instead you'll get it from your dao as shown in first example.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
dao IBaseDao Data access object used to make requests.
Properties:
Name Type Description
permissions Permissions allows checking security information of the Web
baseUrl string API relative url (value = "/web")
Source:
  • list.js, line 16
Example

You access a 'List' by passing a name to the 'lists' property of the dao.

var dao = new SPScript.RestDao(_spPageContextInfo.webAbsoluteUrl);
var list = dao.lists("Tasks");
list.getItemById(12).then(function(item) { console.log(item) });

Methods

addAttachment(itemId, filename, content) → {Promise}

Attach file to an item in the list
Parameters:
Name Type Description
itemId int The SharePoint Id of the item to update
filename string Filename to be put in SharePoint
content string File content
Source:
  • list.js, line 166
Returns:
- A Promise
Type
Promise
Example

Attach 'hello.txt' with content 'Hello World' to itemId 12

list.addAttachment(12, 'hello.txt', 'Hello World').then(function() { console.log"Success") });

addItem(item, requestDigestopt) → {Promise}

Creates a SharePoint list item
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
item object Javascript object representing the list item
requestDigest string <optional>
 Optional request digest token used to authorize the action. One will be automatically retrieved if not provided.
Source:
  • list.js, line 75
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to the inserted list item
Type
Promise
Example

Add a list item. Set Title and Status.

var newItem = {
   Title: "Test Created Item",
   MyStatus: "Red"
};
list.addItem(newItem).then(function(item) { console.log(item) });

Example

Delete attachment 'hello.txt' in itemId 12

Delete the item with an ID of 12

list.deleteItem(12).then(function() { console.log"Success") });

findItem(key, value, odataopt) → {Promise}

Retrieves the first list item that matches the column value you pass
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
key string The column name
value string The column value to match on
odata string <optional>
 OData string
Source:
  • list.js, line 236
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to a list items
Type
Promise
Example

The first item whose Title is "TODO"

list.findItem("Title", "TODO").then(function(item) { console.log(item) });

findItems(key, value, odataopt) → {Promise.<Array>}

Retrieves items in the list based on the value of a column
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
key string The column name
value string The column value to match on
odata string <optional>
 OData string
Source:
  • list.js, line 219
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves an array of list items
Type
Promise.<Array>
Examples

Get all items whose status is "In Progress"

list.findItems("Status", "In Progress").then(function(items) { console.log(items) });

Get first 5 items whose Yes/No field is 'Yes'

list.getItems("MyYesNoField", true, "$top=5").then(function(items) { console.log(items) });

getItemById(id, odataopt) → {Promise}

Retrieves a specific item based on SharePoint ID
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
id int SharePoint integer Id
odata string <optional>
 OData string
Source:
  • list.js, line 48
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to a single list item
Type
Promise
Examples

Get the item with ID of 5.

list.getItemById(5).then(function(item) { console.log(item) });

Only bring back 'Title' and 'Status' using optional OData string

list.getItemById(5, "$select=Title,Status").then(function(items) { console.log(items) });

getItems(odataopt) → {Promise.<Array>}

Retrieves items in the lists
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
odata string <optional>
 OData string
Source:
  • list.js, line 32
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves an array of list items
Type
Promise.<Array>
Examples

Get all items

list.getItems().then(function(items) { console.log(items) });

Get first 5 items by passing in optional OData.

list.getItems("$top=5").then(function(items) { console.log(items) });

info() → {Promise.<SP.Web>}

Retrieves basic information about the list
Source:
  • list.js, line 59
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to an object containing non-deferred properties of an SP.List (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/jj244873.aspx)
Type
Promise.<SP.Web>
Example
list.info().then(function(info) { console.log(info) });

updateItem(itemId, updates, requestDigestopt) → {Promise}

Updates a SharePoint list item
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
itemId int The SharePoint Id of the item to update
updates object Javascript object representing columns you want to update
requestDigest string <optional>
 Optional request digest token used to authorize the action. One will be automatically retrieved if not provided.
Source:
  • list.js, line 111
Returns:
- A Promise
Type
Promise
Example

Update the item's Title

var updates = {
   Title: "Updated Title"
};
list.updateItem(12, updates).then(function() { console.log"Success") });
